intro: Ceanothus africanus, commonly known as the African ceanothus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are usually evergreen, and the flowers can be white, pink, or purple, depending on the variety. Ceanothus africanus is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various climates.
